body_html:
I'm getting a similar optimizer dependent error with the following code on 0.7.0 (hash 875a67f)

assert tf.__version__ == '0.7.0'
tf.reset_default_graph()

initializer = tf.random_uniform_initializer(-0.1, 0.1)
x = tf.placeholder(tf.int32)
p = tf.get_variable('p', shape=[10, 2], initializer=initializer)
x_ = tf.nn.embedding_lookup(p, x)

loss = tf.reduce_sum(tf.abs(x_))
opt = tf.train.RMSPropOptimizer(0.01, decay=0.9, epsilon=0.00001)
train_op = opt.minimize(loss)

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())
    feed = {x: 3}
    print(sess.run([x_], feed_dict=feed))

The code works with Adam and SGD, but not RMSProp.

body:
I'm getting a similar optimizer dependent error with the following code on 0.7.0 (hash 875a67f3d298ab7f7438a3004e4597c71d92b529)

```
assert tf.__version__ == '0.7.0'
tf.reset_default_graph()

initializer = tf.random_uniform_initializer(-0.1, 0.1)
x = tf.placeholder(tf.int32)
p = tf.get_variable('p', shape=[10, 2], initializer=initializer)
x_ = tf.nn.embedding_lookup(p, x)

loss = tf.reduce_sum(tf.abs(x_))
opt = tf.train.RMSPropOptimizer(0.01, decay=0.9, epsilon=0.00001)
train_op = opt.minimize(loss)

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())
    feed = {x: 3}
    print(sess.run([x_], feed_dict=feed))
```

The code works with Adam and SGD, but not RMSProp.
